description: When six-year-old Ruby is chosen to be the first African-American to integrate her local elementary school, she is subjected to the true ugliness of racism for the first time.
name: Ruby Bridges

review.name: Disturbing but important film
review.reviewBody:
I remember watching this film in the 90s when I was less than 10 years old and it was a very scarring movie because of how much they showed the brutality that people faced at the time.

It does show a lot of character psychology very well and how this effected this little girl. I think so very important film but it's definitely not a film that children should watch by themselves because the brutality is really harsh for kids under 10. It's a strong PG-13 film, definitely not appropriate for anybody under 10 or 11 because of the deeply disturbing nature Of racial harassment this little girl receives.

It is very important that it's shown in film because film should not be sugarcoated but it did have a very damaging effect on some people who watch the film at a very young age so it's definitely a very big family viewing film for younger audiences. It's probably more appropriate for high school age
